title: Identify this font
content:
Need to identify the font used on the navigation (right hand side)

[http://www.carnegiedentalgroup.com.au/default.aspx](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111125317/http:/www.carnegiedentalgroup.com.au/default.aspx)

Can anyone help?

Chris
author: kristo

comments.content:
Tough to tell with such small samples. But it seems likely that the navigation is set in the same type as the “Carnegie & Sunshine…” which I believe is Whitney, incorporating the alternate “g.”

[http://www.typography.com/catalog/whitney/charset.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111125317/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/whitney/charset.html)
That seems like a postive id to me. Another remarkable glyph in identifying the font is the majuscule “U”.
